title: As Venezuelan Antagonists Talk, the U.S. Softens Its Stance
description: Negotiations between the Venezuelan government and opposition could lead to an easing of the country’s protracted crisis.

title: Kherson Evacuates Hospitals Under Relentless Russian Shelling
description: “This is the revenge of those who lost,” the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelensky, said of Russia’s attacks.

title: Under a Cross Atop a Shallow Grave, He Found His Father
description: The full extent of Russian war crimes in the city of Kherson and surrounding areas is just coming into focus. These were two of them.

title: Catholic Church Issues Guidelines for Ethical Investing
description: In the midst of a criminal trial of 10 church officials on charges of financial impropriety, the church put forth a long-delayed document that lays out standards for avoiding improper investments.

title: Putin Holds Highly Choreographed Meeting With Mothers of Russian Soldiers
description: The televised event came amid intensifying public criticism over the conditions recent Russian conscripts have been forced to bear.

title: Merkel Says She Lacked the Power to Dissuade Putin from Invading Ukraine
description: Recounting her last state visit to Moscow in August of 2021, Angela Merkel noted that President Vladimir V. Putin would not meet with her alone, as he had done in the past.

title: Trudeau to Testify About Invoking Emergencies Act During Trucker Protest
description: His appearance will conclude six weeks of the inquiry into the government’s use of an emergency law to shut down the blockade.

title: Death Toll From Indonesia Earthquake Rises to 310
description: The quake in Cianjur, an agricultural region in West Java, has killed 310 people and destroyed tens of thousands of homes; dozens of people are still missing.

title: Ukraine Says Nuclear Power Plants Back Online
description: After Russian missile strikes crippled much of Ukraine’s electricity grid, utility crews scrambled to stabilize it. The country relies on nuclear power for more than half of its energy.

title: Holiday Shopping and Inflation
description: We have tips for getting around higher prices this holiday shopping season.

title: Fire Kills 10 in China’s Xinjiang, Raising Questions About Lockdown
description: A fire in a residential high-rise in Urumqi, where many residents have been under lockdown, set off public anger and questions about China’s zero-Covid policy.

title: He Pointed Out a Judge’s Goof. Now, He Faces Jail Time in Fiji.
description: A lawyer who made light of a legal document’s error was convicted of contempt of court, in a sign of the island nation’s eroding civil liberties.

title: ‘Gangnam Style’ Brought K-Pop to the World, but Haunted Its Creator
description: In 2012, the song took over the internet, and it helped pave the way for the global success of Korean pop. But Psy, the artist behind it, spent years trying and failing to replicate the phenomenon.

title: An Israeli Schoolboy Died in the West Bank. To Find His Body, Foes Joined Forces.
description: After Palestinian gunmen refused to hand over a dead Israeli teenager on Tuesday, officials on both sides of the conflict worked together to recover his abducted body.

title: Qataris Say Criticism of Country Amid World Cup Is Rooted in Stereotypes
description: Many in the country say the barrage of criticism about its human rights record and the exploitation of migrant workers is laced with discrimination and hypocrisy.

title: The Only U.S. Territory Without U.S. Birthright Citizenship
description: People born in American Samoa, which has been held by the United States for more than 120 years, are not automatically citizens of the United States.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: After missiles rained down on Ukraine, cutting off water and electricity, people are adjusting to life in the dark.
